result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Steven Henry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, fees and surcharges. Due within 15 months. Failure to pay will result in civil judgment/tax intercept. Cash bond on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Credit for 13 days.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED: Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence to with credit for 13 days time served. 
						
Pay costs, fees and surcharges due within 15 months failure to pay will result in civil judgment/tax intercept
Cash bond on deposit to be applied if applicable
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant

filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Anthony Steven Henry in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  Defendant Anthony Steven Henry in custody.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KKO  
Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.

Plea hearing held

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.    Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Documents received and filed.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum/Elements of the offense 
Victim Impact Statement

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 31

Attorney Angel Johnson in court, defendant Anthony Steven Henry not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing, however, defense requesting more time as to reasons presented to the court. Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Angel Johnson in court, defendant Anthony Steven Henry not in court, in custody.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court for plea and sentencing. Court advised defendant has a pending matter and requesting an adjournment of the matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Steven Henry in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea/sentencing.  Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Steven Henry in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony Steven Henry in court with attorney Kathleen Judith Osvat.  Defendant Anthony Steven Henry in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
